body: Can we Make Dynamic Config File Injectable! @samarabbas

comments.body: @markmark206 we need to evaluate if dynamic config for the server can be injected into Temporal docker image.  Maybe we can expose it as an environment variable for the server.
Can the user attach a volume to the docker image and pass the path to the config file using the existing environment variable?

Based on what's currently in the `docker-compose.yml` , this appears to have been resolved earlier by https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/commit/2a4449cc764dc4d24e226525e85ce0a05539dfab

https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/blob/dfaf475f62a5a4fe8a6a002acce2465d851b2c18/docker/docker-compose.yml#L12

Similarly, if you were deploying this to k8s or similar rather than running the service docker-compose, you could volume mount a config file at runtime and set the `DYNAMIC_CONFIG_FILE_PATH` env var to tell the temporal server which path to read the config from.
Closing this issue as dynamic config file path is configurable.
